list.name: Changes
list.comment: 5/22: I made another tree that has a random value that changes. There are three main tree shapes and they are rotated between each one. I also added that to keypressed.

task.summary: Shifted the tree to desired location on the canvas. Made a second tree that has a random angle and length to vary the shape of the tree from the first tree. Also made a function that calls a random number of branches as well. Tree2 works as intended in the middle of the console, next to the initial tree.

Used matrix algebra and indivual affine transformations (each with a probability) to draw Barnsley fern. The stems and leaves were drawn with recursive and the transformations were based on matrix algebra. Doesn't work properly and am thinking about taking it out of the code.

I took off one of the fractal trees (tree number 2) and made tree number 1 the main tree. I made a “flower” fractal design that’s animated and changes shapes simultaneously. Then I made a keypressed function so when a key ‘k’ is pressed, the tree number 1 appears and both trees are animated.

I first cleaned up the code with keypressed function and the flower fractal design. Then, I made a new class with the Koch snowflake from the Nature of Code book. I have written all the code but it doesn’t run correctly and I’m not sure how to call it in my main method.

First I made a drawing made out of four different recursive circles. Second, I made a rainbow tunnel drawing that changes based on the mouse's location (doesn’t work yet). Finally, I made a rain particle animation that makes rain fall from the sky (does not work yet). I made all three methods inside keypressed too.

I made a new animated heart drawing based on geometry that will paint itself. I then cleaned up all of my keypress functions so that each different key pressed corresponds to a different painting. I also made an instructions page on which keys to press.

5/16 in class: Implemented fractal trees from Shiffman’s Nature Of Code book. The tree will shift forms (change branch angle) based on mouseX’s location by a variable called theta. Also, made the tree branches thicker with each recursion call. The tree was able to work as intended on the console.
5/21 homework: implemented two different circles that calls itself three times. Each recursive call draws a cricle to the right and left of the main circle. Also implemented it in keypressed.
5/21 homework: implemented three other recursive circles that draw themselves three times. Changed all of the background colors and stoke rgb. Also, added to instructions keypressed.
5/21 (1.5 hour homework): I made a flower fractal that draws on itself recursively. I added that to my keypressed and instructions.
5/22: I made another tree that has a random value that changes. There are three main tree shapes and they are rotated between each one. I also added that to keypressed.

MESSAGE.value: Shifted the tree to desired location on the canvas. Made a second tree that has a random angle and length to vary the shape of the tree from the first tree. Also made a function that calls a random number of branches as well. Tree2 works as intended in the middle of the console, next to the initial tree.

Used matrix algebra and indivual affine transformations (each with a probability) to draw Barnsley fern. The stems and leaves were drawn with recursive and the transformations were based on matrix algebra. Doesn't work properly and am thinking about taking it out of the code.

I took off one of the fractal trees (tree number 2) and made tree number 1 the main tree. I made a “flower” fractal design that’s animated and changes shapes simultaneously. Then I made a keypressed function so when a key ‘k’ is pressed, the tree number 1 appears and both trees are animated.

I first cleaned up the code with keypressed function and the flower fractal design. Then, I made a new class with the Koch snowflake from the Nature of Code book. I have written all the code but it doesn’t run correctly and I’m not sure how to call it in my main method.

First I made a drawing made out of four different recursive circles. Second, I made a rainbow tunnel drawing that changes based on the mouse's location (doesn’t work yet). Finally, I made a rain particle animation that makes rain fall from the sky (does not work yet). I made all three methods inside keypressed too.

I made a new animated heart drawing based on geometry that will paint itself. I then cleaned up all of my keypress functions so that each different key pressed corresponds to a different painting. I also made an instructions page on which keys to press.

5/16 in class: Implemented fractal trees from Shiffman’s Nature Of Code book. The tree will shift forms (change branch angle) based on mouseX’s location by a variable called theta. Also, made the tree branches thicker with each recursion call. The tree was able to work as intended on the console.
